4030/A0/04/004/005.status_value: 4347 cases of violence were reported in 2012. There is a slight decrease due mainly to the weakness of the reporting mechanism as well as to the fact that several NGOs working in this area were closed due to financial barriers. 21% of the cases reported are sexual violence. 26% emotionnal and 33% physical violence

100 head teachers and 100 parents oriented on the curriculum. The training of the teachers will start on January 2016 when schools open.

All three phases (literature review  Secondary data analysis from VACS 2007 and Qualitative data collection)of data collection were completed as per planned roadmap. Currently the data is being transcribed and translated. The final report is expected to be ready by April/May 2016.

4030/A0/04/007/001.status_value: Instead of addressing only health sector specific bottlenecks to birth registration  the country has been engaged into a comprehensive CRVS national assessment process. The findings and recommendations from the assessment were endorsed by the Government as a basis for full-scale reform of CRVS.
4030/A0/04/007/001.indicator_name: % Of health facilities providing birth registration services

4030/A0/04/007/001.status_value: A four day National GBV conference  which brought together all stake holders who address violence related matters  discussed and produced a set of comprehensive and sector specific actions to be incorporated in the Violence response national strategy. The strategy is expected to be finalized in early 2016.
4030/A0/04/007/001.indicator_name: Status of strategic action plan on violence

4030/A0/04/007/001.status_value: Due to decommissioning of the Children's Coordination Unit  no progress was achieved with regard to CPWA overall implementation plan  however significant progress was achieved in Justice and Police sectors. Specific Training modules for these two sectors were developed and utilized to capacitate Justice and Police officers.
